content: Who composed the music for the Star Wars film series, winning him multiple Academy Awards?

The music for the Star Wars film series was composed by the legendary John Williams. He has won numerous Academy Awards for his contributions to the franchise, including Oscars for the original Star Wars (now known as Episode IV: A New Hope), The Empire Strikes Back, Return of the Jedi, and the recent entries in the sequel trilogy. His iconic scores have become synonymous with the Star Wars universe and have left an indelible mark on film music history.
